TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {19040=2012 Played in a total of 11 games, while earning nine starts between the pipes for the Beacons … Named Co-captain by his coaches … Earned Little East Conference Goalie of the Week honors after leading UMass to a 12-10 win over UMass Dartmouth … Finished the year having played in over 451 minutes … Tallied a combined 107 saves … Recorded his first win of the season at Huntingdon College (Ala.) after making a combined three saves … Recorded a season-high 20 saves in the win over UMass Dartmouth, which also marked the first conference win in his career … Recorded 15 stops on March 28 at Wheaton College (Mass.) and on April 16 at Mount Ida College … Totaled 14 saves against Plymouth State University … Made a combined 10 saves on April 28 against Little East Conference champions Eastern Connecticut State … Finished the year with a team-best 52 groundballs … Caused a combined eight turnovers … In the April 26 meeting, he was handed an attackman stick and scored his first career hat-trick, while also tallying three assists for a combined six points … Also finished with a career-high 14 groundballs., 21922=PERSONAL/HIGH SCHOOL Earned three letters in lacrosse for Haverford Senior High School ... Named the Fords' Most Valuable Player for his senior campaign ... Played junior hockey for the Philadelphia Little Flyers of the Atlantic Junior Hockey League ... A two-time league All-Star for the Flyers in the Junior A Division ... Born July 13, 1987 ... Son of Steven and Patricia Fitti ... Undecided on major ... Enjoys hockey and other sports ... A member of the UMass Boston Men's Ice Hockey team., 20192=2011 Started in 11 of the 12 games he played in as a junior ... Totaled 583 minutes of action ... Posted 138 saves for a .529 save percentage ... Ended the year with a 3-8 record overall ... Scooped up 30 groundballs and caused eight turnovers ... Recorded 11 or more saves in six straight games ... Finished with a season-high 18 saves on April 16 (Western Conn. State University) and on April 21 (Curry College) ... Held Massachusetts Maritime Academy and Mitchell College to just four goals in each of their non-conference games., 21155=2009 Played 11 games and started 10 contests in goal in his first season of collegiate lacrosse ... Posted a 12.74 goals against average in 570 minutes of action ... Stopped 130 shots for a .518 save percentage ... Ranked second in the Little East Conference with 13.00 saves per game ...Posted double-digit save totals in eight of 10 games, including a season-high of 24 vs. University of Southern Maine on April 21 ... Averaged 18 saves per outing in his final three games ... Recorded his first collegiate victory with four saves in a 15-4 victory at Saint Joseph's College (ME) on April 2 ... Scooped up 29 ground balls, including six outings with two or more ... Picked up a season-high nine ground balls vs. Southern Maine., 20762=2010 Played in a combined seven games as a sophomore ... Saw 375 minutes of playing time in which he combined for 82 saves and a 2-4 record overall ... Held three teams to single-digits in goals ... Tallied a season-high 22 saves against Little East Conference opponent Keene State College ... Recorded five saves in the March 31 win over Emerson College.}
